alert.note: Alert for Kimble; Menard; Schleicher; Sutton (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS San Angelo (Central Texas San Angelo)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 10 at 9:48PM CDT by NWS San Angelo
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of eastern Schleicher, Kimble, Menard and eastern Sutton Counties through 1045 PM CDT... At 947 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Roosevelt, moving northeast at 40 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts of 50 to 55 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Junction, Menard, Telegraph, Saline, Segovia, London, South Llano River State Park, Hext, Roosevelt, Fort Mckavett, Adams, Camp Sol Mayer, Cleo, The Intersection Of Us- 83 And Ranch Road 1773, Yates Crossing, I-10 Near The Sutton- kKmble County Line, Us-377 Near The Kimble-Menard County Line, Us- 83 Near The Kimble-Menard County Line, The Intersection Of Us- 83 And Highway 29 and I-10 Near The Kimble-Kerr County Line. This includes Interstate 10 between Mile Markers 419 and 477. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...55 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 1100 PM CDT for west central Texas.
